div.p:
Middleberg Public School is currently seeking a certified Elementary Education teacher for the 2020-21 school year. You may call the school office at 405-485-3612 or stop by between 8am and 3pm, Monday-Friday for more details or an application.
Middleberg Public School is seeking qualified bus drivers. You may download an application here, or you may stop by the office weekdays from 8am-3pm.
Oklahoma Parent Resources for Student Testing

The Chickasaw Nation Nutrition Services is now accepting applications for the Summer EBT for Children program. This federally funded program is available to anyone; you do not have to be Native American to qualify. Qualifying families will receive approximately $30 of free food per child per month for May, June and July. Follow the link to apply:
Please follow the link to pre-enroll Pre-k students for the 2020-2021 school year.
Current Student Pre-Enrollment for 2020-2021 School Year

hr.p: Middleberg Public Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origins, sex/gender, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services or activities; in access to them in treament of individuals; or in any aspect of their operations. Â The Middleberg Public School system also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.

This notice is provided as required by Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of Â 1973, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, the Age Discrimination Act of 1975, and the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. Questions, complaints, or requests for more information regarding these laws may be forwarded to the designated compliance coordinator:
Joel Read, 2130 County Road 1317, Blanchard, OK Â 73010, 405-485-3612
